description: Last year both Gannett and Sports Illustrated were caught creating fake, “AI” generated journalists to create fake, plagiarism and mistake-prone “journalism.” In both instances the kind of brunchlord executives that fail upward at these kind of dying media companies thought it would be great to replace real human journalism with automated junk — without informing their actual human employees. “AI” (not […]
title: The Real Money In Modern ‘Journalism’ Now Involves Filling The Internet With ‘AI’-Generated Garbage

description: The city of Chicago’s Inspector General is back at it, pointing out things are very, very wrong with the Chicago Police Department. Not that anyone needed any reminders. A long history of disinterest in disciplining misbehaving officers has led to everything from an off-the-books black site operation to more than 100 misconduct charges being racked […]
title: Oversight Report: Chicago PD Doesn’t Care Its Officers Are Involved With Right Wing Extremists

description: It’s pretty rare to see a judge disqualify a law firm from taking on a case. But Judge William Alsup has done just that, disqualifying the litigation powerhouse law firm Quinn Emanuel from representing ExTwitter in a big data scraping case. We wrote about this case back in May, highlighting both the importance and complexities […]
title: Elon Loses His Favorite Law Firm In Data Scraping Case Because They Played Both Sides

description: Embark on the journey of language learning with the Rosetta Stone lifetime subscription for all languages. Rosetta Stone has been the go-to software for language learning for the past 27 years. With its immersive and intuitive training method, you might be reading, writing, and speaking a new language with confidence in no time. It’s on […]
title: Daily Deal: Rosetta Stone

description: Back in 2022, a federal court responded to a challenge of a geofence warrant with some good questions. But its ultimate ruling was a shrug. A geofence warrant obtained by investigators searching for a bank robbery suspect covered a whole lot of ground, subjecting hundreds of innocent people to a search of their geolocation records. […]
title: Fourth Circuit Finds In Favor Of Geofence Dragnet Deployed To Catch Robbery Suspect

description: A few years ago you might recall there was a three year news cycle about how the modern Trump GOP was somehow “serious about antitrust reform this time.” The party, which has never met a consolidated monopoly it didn’t adore (see: airlines, telecom, pharma, health, energy), was suddenly getting credited in the press for being […]
title: Just A Reminder: Authoritarians Don’t ACTUALLY Support ‘Antitrust Reform’

description: While the vast majority of what I get to read about when it comes to intellectual property law generally, and trademark law specifically, makes me roll my eyes, the concept of geographic indicator trademarks actually isn’t one of them. The application of GI marks certainly does get my fur up often times, but the concept […]
title: New Zealand Joins Australia In Denying Geographical Indicator Trademark For ‘Basmati Rice’
